root.string: Use Hit/Miss when displaying attack and defense rolls in chat.
Pay Attack and Damage Effort separately
Death Markers: Place death markers when a dead or dying creature is removed from the combat tracker
Death Markers: Place death markers when an NPC on the combat tracker is reduced to 0 HP
Death Markers: Place death markers when a PC becomes impaired, debilitated, or dead
Characters: How many Descriptors can a PC have?
Characters: How many Focuses can a PC have?
Characters: How many Ancestries can a PC have?
Character Arcs: XP Cost to gain new character arcs
Character Arcs: How much XP is gained for each step of a character arc
Charater Arcs: How much XP is gained when successfully completing a character arc's climax
Charater Arcs: How much XP is gained when failing to complete a character arc's climax
Character Arcs: How much XP is gained when resolving a character arc
Click to invoke a Player Intrusion
Current points in this stat pool
Maximum total points that can be in this stat pool
Base value for this pools maximum based on your type and abilities
Miscellaneous and temporary increases to this stat pool's maximum
Assets given to this defense roll
Miscillaneous modifier added to the defense roll
Total effort you can apply to tests
Total armor against mundane, physical damage
Base Armor granted from equipped items.
Armor granted from abilities or other features
How much of your Armor is immune to effects that would pierce or bypass Armor?
Base amount that your armor increases the cost of applying Speed Effort.
Modifier for the Speed Effort cost penalty (due to advancements or abilities).
Flat modifier applied to initiative rolls
A flat modifier added to your effort limit
Total bonus to recovery rolls. Double-click or drag/drop to initiate a recovery roll.
Flat bonus added to recovery rolls
Click to take a character advancement
The Stat associated with this skill
You do not have enough XP for an advancement.
Drop an item link in this window to link
You are out of ammo for your %s.
Spend %s XP to start this arc?
Complete this step and gain %s XP?
Are you prepared for the climax of this arc?

Did you succeed at the climactic moment of this arc?

Select 'Yes' to mark as successful.
Select 'No' to mark as unsuccessful.

Did you ultimately resolve this arc?

Select 'Yes' to mark as resolved.
Select 'No' to mark as unresolved.
You do not have enough XP to gain a new character arc.
%s spent %s XP to gain a new character arc.
%s gained %s XP for completing a step in one of their character arcs.
%s is ready for a pivotal moment in one of their arcs.
%s successfully completed the finale of one of their character arcs and gains %s XP.
%s was not able to complete the finale of one of their character arcs and gains %s XP.
%s resolved one of their character arcs and gains %s XP.
%s was unable to resolve one of their character arcs.
You already paid the XP cost to start this arc.
You already gained XP for this part of the arc.
Should this ability use the attack and damage properties from the currently equipped weapon.
On the first recovery of the day
On the last recovery of the day
This text is only displayed in the tooltip for this action, and is meant to help context for individual actions.
If set, this action will target the set difficulty rather than the global difficulty.
Entering a skill name will turn this into a skill roll.
Name of the custom stat pool this roll uses.
Stat that's used when rolling this attack. Defaults to Might.
Stat that the target uses to defend against this attack. Defaults to Speed.
This is a flat modifier that's added to the roll. Every +3 is converted to an asset.
Name of the custom stat pool this attack uses.
Name of the custom stat that the target will defend with.
Deal damage to this stat pool. Defaults to Might.
Does this damage bypass damage resistance?
How much damage pierces damage resistance? Leave blank to ignore all resistance.
How much damage pierces armor? Leave blank to ignore all Armor.
Ambient damage ignores armor regardless of stat that's damaged
Name of the custom stat pool this action uses to deal damage.
Name of the custom stat pool this damage is dealt to.
How many stat points are spent when making this attack.
Cost is deducted from this stat pool. Defaults to the Attack Stat.
Name of the custom stat pool this action uses for its cost.
If this heals a stat fully, does any extra healing overflow to other stats?
Name of the custom stat pool this heal uses.
Name of the custom stat pool this healing is applied to.
What kind of value to set the property to. "Cypher level" will set the property to match the cypher level. "Fixed Value" will take a single set value.
Value that is assigned to the selected property
Value that is assigned to the selected property
Value that is assigned to the selected property
Modify the value with the selected operation
The value is modified by this kind of number.
The amount by which the value is modified by the selected operation
Limits when the modification is applied to this action by comparing the cypher level to a specific value
The cypher level is compared to this number to determine whether this modification should be applied.
Can this ability be selected multiple?
Name of the custom stat pool this ability uses for its cost.
If checked, this ability will be given to the character. If unchecked, this ability will be listed as an optional ability for the character to select for its tier.
Tier this ability is offered at
The number of additional points to divide among stat pools.
How many tier 1 abilities can a player select
How many tier 2 abilities can a player select
How many tier 3 abilities can a player select
How many tier 4 abilities can a player select
How many tier 5 abilities can a player select
How many tier 6 abilities can a player select
Stat that's used to make attacks with this weapon.
Name of the custom stat this attack uses.
Stat that's used to defend against attacks made with this weapon.
Name of the custom stat that the target will defend with.
Stat pool that this weapon deals damage to (only applies when attacking PCs).
Name of the custom stat pool that this damage is dealt to.
How much damage pierces armor? Leave blank to ignore all Armor.
An extra cost added to every level of Speed effort that is applied while this armor is equipped.
Armor value applied against the specified damage type. Positive armor reduces damage taken. Negative armor increases damage taken. A value of 0 indicates immunity to the damage type.
How does this special armor interact with damage?\nReduction = reduce incoming damage by the amount.\nThreshold = ignore all damage less than the amount.
If "Yes", then this armor will apply to all damage types EXCEPT the one specified in this armor entry.

Does this armor apply to ambient damage?
No: This armor does not apply to ambient damage
Inclusive: This armor applies to normal damage of the given type AND ambient damage.
Exclusive:This armor applies ONLY to ambient damage of the given type

Does this armor ignore effects that would pierce armor?
No: This armor is not pierce-proof
Inclusive: This armor is pierce-proof for the given type
Exclusive:This armor applies ONLY to damage that would pierce armor
Reduce all non-%s damage taken by %s
Increase all non-%s damage taken by %s
Ignore %s damage unless it deals at least %s damage
Ignore all non-%s damage unless it deals at least %s damage
Limit %s damage to %s damage from a single hit
Limit non-%s damage to %s damage from a single hit
%s is attacking you, defend yourself with %s!\nDifficulty: %s
Select which stat you would like to pay the cost with
This ability can be selected multiple times. How many times would you like to take it?
Train in a skill or ability
Select an ability from your Type
Reduce armor's Speed Effort cost by 1
Select an ability from your Focus
Difficulty that all non-targeted rolls are made against. Use the scroll wheel to increase or decrease this value.
A d20 roll of equal to or lower than this value triggers a GM intrusion.
Invoke a GM Intrusion on this PC (and grant them 1 XP)
The selected PC has no active user.
The GM has invoked an intrusion on %s!
%s has accepted the intrusion. They gain 1 %s and give 1 %s to %s.
%s has spent 1 %s to refuse the intrusion.
The GM has invoked an intrusion on %s!\n\nSelect another character to grant 1 %s to.
Accept this intrusion. You and %s both gain 1 %s.
You must select another character to give an %s to in order to accept the intrusion.
You don't have enough %s to refuse this intrusion.
You are invoking a player intrusion! Select from the options below (you have %s XP).
You are invoking a player intrusion! Select from the options below (you have %s XP and %s hero points).
Reroll any roll, even if you didn't roll it, and the dice roller chooses the best result.
Spend 1 %s to introduce a solution to a problem
This can affect a single object, feature, or NPC, and should be about adjusting the scenario you find yourself in.
Spend 2 XP to gain training in a skill that is useful only for your current surroundings
These are usually story-based, and allow a character to get immediate training in a skill for half the normal cost, even if the training is limited to a specific location or situation.
Spend 3 XP to gain a long-term benefit (contact, home, title, wealth, etc)
These benefits are a means of integrating game mechanics with story, are usually permanent, and not easily taken away. You have agency over what you've gained.
%s has invoked a player intrusion to reroll a die!
%s has invoked a player intrusion to adjust the scenario!
%s has invoked a player intrusion to gain training a skill!
%s has invoked a player intrusion to gain a long-term benefit!
